intro: Reseda valentina, commonly known as Valentine's Reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and produces clusters of yellow or white flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and somewhat woody at the base. Reseda valentina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
